oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Monk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A small scruffy black and white terrier, collie and schnauzer mixed stray came into Beautiful Jim Key's life around 1900 during an engagement in Atlantic City. Monk became a self-appointed guardian and life-long companion to the talented horse, spending
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Key, William, -- 1833-1909; Beautiful Jim Key (Horse); Humane education -- Case studies -- History -- United States; Horses -- Case studies -- Training -- History -- United States; Horse trainers -- Case studies -- History -- United States
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This image comes from Scrapbook #2 of the collecion and shows Monk, Jim Key's guard dog and constant companion, standing on his back legs in front of angled mirrors. The illusion is created of five Monks in the picture, instead of one.
